JumpScale.baselib.remote.cluster.Cluster module¶

activateAvahi(hostnames=[])[source]¶
connect()[source]¶
connectClusterToMyCode(hostnames=[])[source]¶

will connect mount /opt/code on each node to my /opt/code over nfs

connectClusterToMyJpackages(hostnames=[])[source]¶

connect the nodes of the cluster to my /opt/qbase6/var/owpackages directory also push my owpackages configuration to the other clusternodes allows the cluster to install from my local owpackages (not from the central repo)

connectMeToNfsShares(sharepath='/opt', hostnames=[])[source]¶

make connections between me and the nodes in the cluster will be mounted on, /mnt/$hostname/$sharepath e.g. /mnt/node1/opt

createCifsShare(sharename='opt', sharepath='/opt', rootpasswd='rooter', hostnames=[])[source]¶

per node only creates 1 cifs share, other shares will be lost carefull will overwrite previous shares

createPublicNfsShare(sharepath='/opt', hostnames=[])[source]¶

per node only creates 1 nfs share, no passwords for now!!!! carefull will overwrite previous shares

execute a method on the nodes as specified

JumpScale.baselib.remote.cluster.ClusterFactory module¶

class JumpScale.baselib.remote.cluster.ClusterFactory.ClusterFactory[source]¶
create(clustername='', domainname='', ipaddresses=, []superadminpassword='', superadminpasswords=[])[source]¶

domainname needs to be unique clustername is only a name which makes it easy for you to remember and used to store in config file

delete(clustername='')[source]¶

Delete a cluster with clustername from the configuration

get(clustername='', domainname='')[source]¶

return cluster for specified domain or shortname, there needs to be a cluster defined already before otherwise no nodes will be found config file which stores this info is at $qbasedir/cfg/jsconfig/clusterconfig.cfg only one of th 2 params is required

list()[source]¶

return list of clusternames

listAvahiEnabledMachines()[source]¶

writeTemplate(destpath, templatepath, replace=, []silent=False)[source]¶
@param destpath: path of node where writing to is starting from root
if destpath==”” will be same as templatepath but in qbase in other words destpath=/opt/qbase3/$templatepath

@param templatepath : /opt/qbase3/utils/defaults/$templatepath @param replace [[find,replacewith],[find2,replace2]]
